Articles.Content: A thread for my ISS replica, which is an entry to @Akagi's Historical Replica Challenge.

Launch 1: Zarya

Spoiler

On the pad

Liftoff!

To be honest, the ascent wasn't the best because I was trying to get the inclination right. (And also, I'm still bad at KSP)

And of course, I forgot to take screen shots of most of the ascent. Well, here it is almost in orbit.

Final orbit. (Not exactly accurate to real life, but the inclination is correct and orbital height isn't extremely far off)

Zarya in orbit

Now I need to build a Space Shuttle to launch Unity.

Going well!

How did you lose the badge?

2 hours ago, Akagi said:

How did you lose the badge?

3rd Great Number war

16 minutes ago, Kerb24 said:

3rd Great Number war

a glitch?

13 minutes ago, Akagi said:

a glitch?

This.

8 minutes ago, Kerb24 said:

This.

i revoke that

11 minutes ago, Kerb24 said:

This.

I left the Number Wars

it was just arguing
Sorry I haven't been doing this, it's just that I can't make planes, and so my Space Shuttle still doesn't work.
Okay so now my Space Shuttle mostly works, it's just that the landings are a bit kerbal because some of the Wing panels may break off. Is this allowed for the challenge?

Launch 2: Unity

Spoiler

On the Launch Pad

Liftoff!

Ascending

Coasting

Payload bay open

External Tank detached

Near Zarya

I tried to use a robotic arm for the docking, but KSP robotics are KSP robotics, and the docking caused tons of frustration.

When the modules did dock, this happened. No idea how.

Also, the Arm broke.

Deorbiting

Re-entry

Wasn't able to land at the KSC, so landed in some random flat area

Landed hard and rolled down a hill, breaking a few parts. But most of it is fine.

Now I need to launch Zvezda.

On 4/25/2022 at 12:59 PM, Kerb24 said:

Okay so now my Space Shuttle mostly works, it's just that the landings are a bit kerbal because some of the Wing panels may break off. Is this allowed for the challenge?

The more Kerbal the better!
Roll over on your back for the accent when you start your gravity turn, that should help. The space shuttle wasn't designed to fly like that. Hollywood has lied to you.

10 minutes ago, snkiz said:

Roll over on your back for the accent when you start your gravity turn, that should help. The space shuttle wasn't designed to fly like that. Hollywood has lied to you.

I will try to do that, but with this ascent, I had basically no idea how to fly it.

Looking great so far. Looks like stock KSPs?

So you are going to replicate the build process, too?

55 minutes ago, Death Engineering said:

Looking great so far. Looks like stock KSPs?

So you are going to replicate the build process, too?  

First, Thanks. Second, I'm using restock and restock plus. Third, I will try to.

In orbit

Next will be the Z1 Truss.

Launch 4: Z1 Truss

Spoiler

On the Launch Pad

Liftoff

For some reason this shuttle is extremely unstable when flying inverted

In orbit

Payload bay open

Rendezvous

Modules Added (I realize I messed up the orientations looking at it now)

Re-entry

Landing in the middle of nowhere

Drogue chute away

Landed too hard, tipped over, and destroyed a wing. At least the crew are fine

Next up is the P6 Truss

I have encountered an issue. The solar arrays, even when retracted, don't fit in the payload bay. I don't know how to redesign them to make them fit.

On 4/16/2022 at 3:55 PM, Akagi said:

i revoke that

I left the Number Wars

it was just arguing

It's way better now days. You should come back some time!
So, this project has so far been the most frustrating thing I've ever done in any video game, but I think I know how to make it easier.

Launch 5: P6 Truss

Spoiler

On the Launch pad

Liftoff! 

SRBs detached

In orbit

External Tank detached

Docked

Solar panels attached and deployed

Re-entry

Gliding

Landed too hard, broke off the nose cone, bounced back upwards, and broke the vertical stabilizer.

I think I'll take a short break from this.

17 hours ago, Kerb24 said:

Landed too hard, broke off the nose cone, bounced back upwards, and broke the vertical stabilizer.

You are landing in the forest!   

Totally enjoying this thread and don't feel like you have to rush through it. The hardest part about a long-term mission like this is not getting personally burned-out.
